data.status: Karachi Kings need 79 runs in 87 balls

comm_lines.comm: Finn to Denly, FOUR, to deep mid wicket
Finn to Denly, no run, a meek flirt. Stays stuck in the crease, hands poking out, and the ball has enough fizz to go past the edge
Finn to Denly, no run, too close for comfort as he tries drilling it down the ground. Not quite
Gohar to Denly, 1 run, jumps down, mis-hoicking it in front of square in the process
Gohar to Denly, no run, squeeze whip off the toes to short fine leg
Gohar to Babar Azam, 1 run, straighter. Quietly rolls over the strike with a nudge through mid-wicket
Gohar to Denly, 1 run, fired into the pads. Typically after being hit for a six. Tucked round the corner

Gohar to Denly, FOUR, flush on the adverts. Some flight dished up for a change, and Denly takes full toll. Makes room for himself, for his arms and goes inside-out over extra cover. Duminy does his part of giving it a six, but the umpires still want to go upstairs. And they've figured out it is on the half volley
Gohar to Babar Azam, 1 run, charges down, strokes it back to Gohar, who in his attempted throw threat lets it go through his palms
Finn to Babar Azam, 1 run, 137.1kph, a neat roll of the wrists to run it to fine leg
Babar Azam, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Finn to Manzoor, out Lbw!! First the finger goes up. And then Manzoor goes up in review. Looks pretty plumb as he messes up his slog across the line. Struck plumb in front of middle .. and that's what the ball tracking tells us too. Middle of leg. Oh what a waste. But Islamabad finally get something to cheer about. Manzoor lbw b Finn 15(12) [4s-1 6s-1]
Finn to Manzoor, THAT'S OUT!! Lbw!!
Finn to Denly, 1 run, opens up his bat face, punching it square to point
Finn to Manzoor, 1 run, right in the blockhole. Manzoor, after all his power in his drive can only dig it out towards mid-on
Finn to Manzoor, 2 runs, slashes hard at the width, into the turf and the bounce it has is enough to take it over backward point
Finn to Manzoor, no run, 131.2kph, full, on the base of off. Manzoor bends, tries drilling it straight down. Can't quite time it right
Steven Finn, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Gohar to Denly, no run, a calm knock back down the pitch
Gohar to Denly, no run, arches deep, punching it out, but can't breach cover
Gohar to Denly, no run, behind the line, settles to block
Gohar to Denly, SIX, oh flat. Bang in the slot, Denly is already on a knee and slogs, mowing it into cow corner. Somebody, catch that crore, somebody
Gohar to Denly, wide, sprays down leg, well down in fact
Gohar to Manzoor, 1 run, backs away, wants to slog. Just can't get into position properly. Ends up skewing it away off the under half of his bat through leg
Gohar to Denly, leg byes, 1 run, feeds the legs. Tickled off it, to short fine
Amad Butt to Manzoor, FOUR, juicy half tracker. Manzoor rocks deep, amplifies and heaves it away. In front of square .. and the powerplay does the rest
Amad Butt to Manzoor, SIX, on the shorter side. Manzoor goes tall, reaching under the bounce and carves it away behind point. All the way too
Amad Butt to Denly, 1 run, lines himself up, dropping it towards mid-on
Amad Butt to Denly, FOUR, all the width. Denly stretches, gets close and drills it through the covers. Gee, this is easy
Amad Butt to Denly, no run, another pitch sticker, Denly continues losing his timing
Amad Butt to Denly, no run, throws his hands out to cut. Under-chops it into the turf
Amad Butt, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
Gohar to Manzoor, no run, a quick shuffle across. Sticks out the defence
Gohar to Manzoor, no run, goes slogging. Without connection though
Gohar to Denly, 1 run, tries spinning it across the stumps. Denly uses it to do down the ground
Gohar to Manzoor, 1 run, tucked away, round the corner
Gohar to Manzoor, 3 wides, well down leg, turning further too. And the keeper's fumbling as well
Gohar to Manzoor, no run, flat. Manzoor sensibly plays for the angle rather than the turn. Taps it again
Gohar to Manzoor, no run, a slider to begin. Knocked to leg off the back foot
Manzoor and Denly are at the crease. Manzoor is on strike. Gohar will open the attack
We're back. Spin to start things off.

21:48 Local Time: Islamabad have been wrapped up for 124. The innings never took off, batsmen were struggling to get going right from the start. Thanks to the slow nature of the pitch. Add to that is Karachi's disciplined bowling. None of the batsmen could convert their starts and didn't bother to bide their time as well. Outcome is a below-par total. Barring a couple of blips in the field, Karachi were outstanding. Usman Khan was superb, with the new cherry as well as towards the end, picking up four wickets. Can they emulate their performance with the bat? Mind you, it's a do or die game for them. If they win, they qualify. Let's see how it goes. Back shortly, stay tuned.

Usman Khan to Finn, out Lbw!! Finn is given out lbw, he reviews. No issues with the front foot. Oh goodness! Looks plumb. Is hit right onto his boot - in-line with the stumps. No bat at all. Three reds. Gone. Pretty straightforward decision. Usman has been brilliant today and fittingly, finishes off things. Pin-point, swerving in at the stumps. Moved in the air and pings Finn flush on the boot as he failed to get his bat in-line with the delivery. Plumbah. Crashing middle. Finn lbw b Usman Khan 0(1)
Usman Khan to Finn, THAT'S OUT!! Lbw!!
Usman Khan to Amad Butt, 1 run, full on leg, whipped away to deep mid-wicket
Usman Khan to Amad Butt, no run, low full toss, drilled to long-on and Butt declines the single
Steven Finn, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Usman Khan to Gohar, out Caught by Afridi!! Another ones bites the dust. Back of the length outside off, Gohar with both his feet cemented to the crease slashed at that. Top-edge is found and sends it high towards cover. Afridi calls for it and clings onto it. Gohar c Afridi b Usman Khan 3(7)
Usman Khan to Gohar, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Usman Khan to Gohar, 2 runs, cannoned off the meat towards long-off. Morgan slides near the ropes and saves a couple of runs
Usman Khan to Amad Butt, 1 run, angling on middle, Butt nudges it to deep mid-wicket
Tymal Mills to Gohar, no run, on a length around off, Gohar defends it off the back foot
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, 1 run, very full outside off, squeezed to third man
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, FOUR, hammered! Mills and his predictable back of the hand slower balls. Short on off, Butt stays on the back foot and flat-bats it past mid-off
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, no run, short outside off, Butt stands tall and punches it to point
Tymal Mills to Gohar, 1 run, good length delivery just outside off, Gohar opens the bat face and uses the angle to direct it to third man
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, 1 run, back of the hand slower ball, Butt waits and nurdles it to mid-wicket
Usman Khan to Gohar, no run, fullish outside off, pushed to cover
Usman Khan to Gohar, no run, beaten again. Tad shorter and straightens off the deck. Gohar pokes and misses
Usman Khan to Gohar, no run, pitched up and holding its line outside off, foxes the tail-ender, who had no clue. Holds his bat in line and is beaten on the outside edge
Zafar Gohar, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Usman Khan to Faheem Ashraf, out Bowled!! Ashraf's tryst with destiny is over. Usman Khan continues to be impressive. Full and jagged back in, too pacy for Ashraf. Went for an across-the-line swipe and misses. Off-stump disturbed. Faheem Ashraf b Usman Khan 4(8)
Usman Khan to Faheem Ashraf, THAT'S OUT!! Bowled!!
Usman Khan to Amad Butt, 1 run, straighter line, shaved to long-on
Usman Khan to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run, another chance goes begging. Babar Azam drops a sitter. Miscue from Ashraf, skies it to long-on. Babar sets himself under it, but it grasses it. Absolute dolly
Usman Khan [2.0-0-11-1] is back into the attack
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, 2 runs, forced sweetly to sweeper cover. The fielder fumbles and they nab the second
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, no run, persists with shortish stuff, cut to point

Tymal Mills to Faheem Ashraf, leg byes, 1 run, "That's worth a shout," says Alan Wilkins on air. Short and nipped back in, catches Ashraf in a soup. Doesn't combat for the extra bounce and is hit high on the pad. Height was the concern there
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, 1 run, in the corridor outside off, Butt uses his soft hands to steer it through cover
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, no run, back of a length and outside off, Butt flashes and misses
Tymal Mills to Amad Butt, no run, 142.8kph, short of length at the body. Butt rides the bounce and quells it into the pitch
Amir to Amad Butt, 1 run, short of length on middle, turned to mid-wicket
Amir to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run, on a length just outside off, poked to point
Amir to Faheem Ashraf, no run, short and Ashraf misses the pull. Beaten by pace
Amir to Faheem Ashraf, no run, full around off, Ashraf waits and dabs it to point
Amad Butt, right handed bat, comes to the crease
With that wicket, they'll take the time-out.

Amir to Shadab Khan, out Caught by Babar Azam!! Wickets are tumbling. Islamabad are throwing wickets away cheaply. Pitched up and wafted it wider of off. Shadab went after it only to mistime it. Off the toe-end and slices it in the night sky, only as far as mid-off. Babar keeps his eyes on the ball and takes it calmly. Shadab Khan c Babar Azam b Amir 8(10)
Amir to Shadab Khan, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Amir to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run, short and peckering the fourth stump line, dinked to third man
Mohammad Amir [2.0-0-11-0] is back into the attack
Tymal Mills to Shadab Khan, no run, shortish outside off, punched to point
Tymal Mills to Faheem Ashraf, 1 run, veering on leg, glanced away to fine leg
Faheem Ashraf, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Tymal Mills to Asif Ali, out Bowled!! And Mills has the last laugh. Change of angle doing the trick. Breaks into a celebration. Full and this one held its line after pitching, Ali was playing inside the line and the ball beats his outside edge to kiss the off-pole. End of an entertaining knock from Ali. Asif Ali b Tymal Mills 34(14) [4s-1 6s-4]
Tymal Mills to Asif Ali, THAT'S OUT!! Bowled!!

Tymal Mills to Asif Ali, SIX, "A star is born," gushes Ramiz Raja on air. Ali is in full flow. Woah! What a shot. Leans across, plants his front foot and smacks the leather off it to send it soaring over long-off

Tymal Mills to Asif Ali, SIX, Ali is smacking it pretty cleanly here. Fullish outside off, Ali gets under it and lifts it, plenty of height but enough wings to take it all the way over the ropes at long-off
Tymal Mills to Asif Ali, 2 runs, driven to the right of sweeper cover, two taken
Afridi to Asif Ali, 1 run, 100kph, chopped to sweeper cover
Afridi to Shadab Khan, 1 run, tucked away into the gap at mid-wicket
Afridi to Shadab Khan, 2 runs, on the pads, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
Afridi to Asif Ali, 1 run, tossed up outside off, push-driven to cover
Afridi to Asif Ali, no run, flat outside off, punched to point
Afridi to Shadab Khan, 1 run, floated up, poked to cover
Mohammad Irfan to Asif Ali, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Asif. Mohammad Irfan feeds another in the slot for Asif. Almost a carbon copy of last six. Stand and dismiss stuff, straight down the ground
Mohammad Irfan to Asif Ali, SIX, this is like adding salt into the wounds. Mohammad Irfan misses the length, dishes out in the arc for Ali. Tonked straight over the bowler's head
Mohammad Irfan to Asif Ali, no run, curving on off, defended
Mohammad Irfan to Shadab Khan, 1 run, moving away outside off, Shadab opens the bat face and glides it to third man
Mohammad Irfan to Shadab Khan, 2 runs, in the air and dropped. First blip in the field from Karachi. Khan miscues and skies it towards mid-off. The fielder moves across, gets both hands but shells it
Mohammad Irfan to Shadab Khan, no run, homing on off, defended
Afridi to Asif Ali, FOUR, threads the gap. Flat and width on offer, Ali goes deep and cuts it in the pocket between short third man and backward point
Afridi to Asif Ali, no run, slow and short outside off, patted to point
Afridi to Shadab Khan, 1 run, drifting in, heaved to deep mid-wicket
Afridi to Shadab Khan, no run, slanter outside off, punched to point
Shadab Khan, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Afridi to Walton, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. 300 T20 wickets for Afridi. And out comes his trademark waving off the hand celebration. Rifled full and quick, Walton fails to connect with the downtown slog and the ball knocks off the off-pole. They check for a no-ball, but Afridi's foot is fine and well behind the line. Half the side back in the hut for Islamabad United. Walton b Afridi 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
Afridi to Walton, THAT'S OUT!! Bowled!!
Afridi to Asif Ali, 1 run, flatter outside off, Asif Ali spanks it through cover
Mohammad Irfan to Asif Ali, 1 run, full on the pads, whisked away to deep mid-wicket
Asif Ali, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Mohammad Irfan to Talat, out Caught by Ingram!! Picks out sweeper cover. Islamabad lose two wickets in two overs and find themselves in a fix. Second wicket for Mohammad Irfan. Full and outside off, Talat slapped it hard but fails to keep it down. Finds sweeper cover, who gets across and settles under it. Talat c Ingram b Mohammad Irfan 1(2)
Mohammad Irfan to Talat, THAT'S OUT!! Caught!!
Mohammad Irfan to Walton, 1 run, full on the stumps, bunted to mid-on

Mohammad Irfan to Walton, SIX, bosh. Walton goes downtown. Plenty of power and straight off the meat. "Comes off the bat like a gun," says Daren Ganga on air. Stood tall, flexes his mucles and biffs it powerfully over long-off
Mohammad Irfan to Talat, 1 run, tapped to point
Mohammad Irfan to Walton, 1 run, tailing in, a low full toss. Slapped to long-on
Hussain Talat, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Afridi is getting some treatment for his cramps, the physio is out. Seems okay now and the crowd are chuffed.

Afridi to Misbah, out Bowled!! Gone. The LED glows. This was coming, ain't it? After firing cannons, Afridi slows it up and keeps it on the stumps. Misbah went low for a almighty swipe and misses. Straight through the gate and crashes the stumps. Afridi wins the battle of the veterans. Misbah scratchy stay is over. Misbah b Afridi 19(23) [4s-3]
Afridi to Misbah, THAT'S OUT!! Bowled!!
Afridi is in some discomfort. Cramps troubling him, i guess.
Afridi to Misbah, no run, Afridi is keeping it tight. Pushed through quick, Misbah fails to connect with his pull and is struck on the thigh pad
Afridi to Misbah, no run, quicker outside off, Misbah scythes it to point

Afridi to Walton, leg byes, 1 run, Afridi aborts his appeal mid-way, knowing that it was heading down leg. Another flat-darter, zips through the deck and Walton set himself for a slog. Hits him on the back leg
Afridi to Misbah, leg byes, 1 run, skidding in with the arm, slams Misbah on the pad and trickles to cover
Afridi to Misbah, no run, lasered in, Misbah almost fetches it from the keeper's glove. Smears it to point
Mohammad Irfan to Walton, FOUR, Walton improvises and gets the desired result. Walks across, preempts and scoops it over short fine leg
Mohammad Irfan to Misbah, leg byes, 1 run, scissored in late, pins Misbah on the pad as he was moving across
Mohammad Irfan to Misbah, 2 runs, carved away through point. Two stolen

Mohammad Irfan to Misbah, FOUR, Misbah does it again. So expert at this delicate touches. Uses Mohammad Irfan's pace, waits till an eternity and glides his bat. Outside edge is found but Misbah directed it at the invisible first slip. The keeper flew to his right but it eludes him
Mohammad Irfan to Walton, 1 run, kicks off from a length just outside off, Walton rolls his wrists and places it to deep mid-wicket
Mohammad Irfan to Walton, no run, whoosh. 126.6kph, full and just outside off. Walton winds up for a biggie. Blindly swings and makes no contact
Mohammad Irfan Jnr [1.0-0-8-1] is back into the attack
Afridi to Walton, 1 run, flat and snaking in just outside off, Walton waits on the back foot and pushes it to cover
Afridi to Misbah, 1 run, 96kph, Afridi fires it quick again. Misbah guides it to short third man
Afridi to Walton, 1 run, sliding in, Walton backs away and with a closed bat face nudges it through mid-wicket
Afridi to Misbah, 1 run, armer from Afridi, punched through cover
Afridi to Misbah, 2 runs, flatter outside off, Misbah flays the cut square on the off-side, adds two to the tally
Afridi to Misbah, no run, drifting in, Misbah defends
Shahid Afridi, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
Usman Khan to Misbah, 1 run, backs away and drags the pull into the leg-side
Usman Khan to Misbah, FOUR, Misbah breaks the shackles. Full on off, Misbah sets a solid base and extends his arms to lift it high and over mid-on. Couple of bounces and into the fence

Usman Khan to Misbah, no run, chin music for Misbah continues. Another lifter that has him in trouble. Hops across and drops it to cover. Walton was looking for a single, had come half-way down the track before he was sent back by Misbah. Turns and dives, Usman collects and fires a throw but misses the target. Anyway, Walton was in
Usman Khan to Walton, 1 run, tucked away through square leg
Usman Khan to Walton, FOUR, tripe. Short and down leg, Walton gets inside the line and helps it away fine past short fine leg
Usman Khan to Walton, no run, length delivery shaping on off, defended
Usman Khan [1.0-0-1-1] is back into the attack
Tymal Mills to Misbah, no run, another back of a length delivery into Misbah's body, he negates the threat
Tymal Mills to Misbah, no run, now serves the sucker ball and Misbah nearly took the bait. Goes chasing for a extravagant drive and angle does him in. Beaten!

Tymal Mills to Misbah, no run, ah, Mills is extracting some vicious bounce here. Hits the deck hard on a short of length and it bites off the deck to rap Misbah on the glove again. Poor technique from Islamabad skipper, he's usally good in handling short balls, not on this occasion

Tymal Mills to Misbah, no run, cripes! A brutal short delivery from Mills, has Misbah in a tangle. Takes his eyes off the ball after seeing the ball rise sharply. Misbah presents his bat forward and is hit on the glove. Ouchy
Tymal Mills to Misbah, no run, full outside off, Misbah lunges forward and steers it to cover-point
Tymal Mills to Walton, 1 run, very full outside off, Walton slices the drive to third man
Tymal Mills, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Mohammad Irfan to Misbah, no run, angles it at the stumps, Misbah shuffles across and blocks it

Mohammad Irfan to Misbah, FOUR, intentionally done. Brilliant from Misbah, deliberately opened the bat face at the last instant. The ball takes a bit of outside edge but no slip ensures that it runs through the vacant cordon and runs away to the third man fence
Mohammad Irfan to Misbah, no run, darts it in the vicinity of off, defended
Misbah-ul-Haq, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Mohammad Irfan to Hales, out Caught&Bowled!! Is Mohammad Irfan a Shikhar Dhawan fan? Does a thigh-five after pouching an excellent return catch. Hales gets carried away a bit; this length delivery holds up on the surface. Hales smacks it hard back to the bowler and fails to keep it down. Mohammad Irfan shows superb reflexes and grabs it fuss-free. Prized scalp. Hales c and b Mohammad Irfan 11(9) [4s-2]
Mohammad Irfan to Hales, THAT'S OUT!! Caught&Bowled!!
Mohammad Irfan to Hales, FOUR, short and Hales latches onto it. Goes deep and throws the kitchen sink on the cut. Elevates it over point
Mohammad Irfan to Walton, leg byes, 1 run, slingy back of a length delivery, climbs off the deck and strikes Walton on the thigh pad
Mohammad Irfan Jnr, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Amir to Hales, no run, slanted outside off, Hales pushes it gently to point
Amir to Hales, no run, another cutter that grips on the surface, Hales watchfully stabs it down the pitch

Amir to Hales, no run, was it the slower delivery? Yes, befuddles Hales. Off-cutter from Amir, stops on the pitch and Hales checks his defence. Hits him on the sticker and it goes on the bounce to mid-on
Amir to Hales, 2 runs, uses his rubber wrists and nudges it in front of square on the leg-side. Gets two
Amir to Hales, FOUR, the ploy was good from Amir but execution went wrong. Slower delivery, too full outside off. Hales bends his knee and times it beautifully through cover
Amir to Hales, wide, 142.3kph, pacy short delivery from Amir, but the line is down leg
Amir to Hales, no run, very full outside off, Hales cracks the drive to extra cover
Usman Khan to Walton, no run, curved in late, Walton hastily hangs his bat forward, failing to account for the inswing. The ball jags in and takes the inside edge, rolls to short fine leg
Usman Khan to Walton, no run, cutting in from a length, Walton is right behind the line to block it
Chadwick Walton, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Usman Khan to Duminy, out Lbw!! That's plumb in front. No luck this time around for Duminy. Has to depart. Early breakthrough for Karachi, just what they needed. Lovely inswinger from Usman, swung in late on a yorker length almost and Duminy completely plays down the wrong line. Misses and is pinged bam low on the pad - right in front of middle. Usman knew it straightaway and started celebrating. Duminy lbw b Usman Khan 4(9) [4s-1]
Usman Khan to Duminy, THAT'S OUT!! Lbw!!
Usman Khan to Duminy, no run, 139.6kph, width on offer. Duminy chases and creams it to cover-point
Usman Khan to Duminy, no run, back of a length around off, Duminy drops it softly to cover
Whoops. UltraEdge shows a murmur on 0.5
Usman Khan to Hales, 1 run, Hales is off the mark. Good length delivery nipping in, Hales knocks it wide of mid-on
Usman Khan, comes into the attack
Amir to Duminy, no run, shortish outside off, Duminy laces the cut to point

Amir to Duminy, no run, peach. What a riposte from Amir. Shaping away in the channel and tails away pretty late. Duminy goes on a fishing expedition and beaten all ends up. Mild appeal for a caught-behind, only Amir was interested but there was no edge there. Morgan asks the keeper for a possible check but nothing there

Amir to Duminy, FOUR, wow. First runs for Duminy and Islamabad. Half-volley on the stumps, Duminy presents the full face of the bat and drives it ram-rod straight down the ground. Ah, sheer class from Duminy
Amir to Duminy, no run, three dots. Full and attacking the stumps, Duminy bunts it with a full face of the bat to mid-on
Amir to Duminy, no run, crunching sound of the willow as Duminy drives a half-volley crisply to mid-off
One slip in place.
Amir to Duminy, no run, bit of a warm-up delivery from Amir. Full and swinging into Duminy's pad. The southpaw gets forward and blocks it with his straight
Duminy and Hales are at the crease. Duminy is on strike. Amir will open the attack

Alright. Minutes away from the start. Karachi Kings in a huddle. Out walk the openers for Islamabad. New partner for JPD. Hales it is. Amir to begin things. The countdown starts. "Let's play" is the message on the giant screen.
Where are your calculators?

* A win for Karachi tonight would take them to second place
* If Islamabad win by 15 runs, Karachi risk being eliminated
Teams:
Karachi Kings (Playing XI): Joe Denly, Khurram Manzoor, Babar Azam, Colin Ingram, Eoin Morgan(c), Shahid Afridi, Mohammad Rizwan(w), Mohammad Irfan Jnr, Mohammad Amir, Usman Khan, Tymal Mills
Islamabad United (Playing XI): Chadwick Walton(w), Jean-Paul Duminy, Alex Hales, Hussain Talat, Asif Ali, Misbah-ul-Haq(c), Faheem Ashraf, Shadab Khan, Zafar Gohar, Amad Butt, Steven Finn
Misbah: Every game is important, especially going into the play-offs. We're making three changes, the guys have a few niggles and we need to set them right before the knockouts.

Morgan: We're going to bowl first. A little bit of dew around and knowing what you are going to chase helps. We know we have to win and have to get past an in-form team. We need to observe what Islamabad do with their batting and make our plans accordingly.
Karachi Kings have won the toss and have opted to field

Meanwhile, it's a dead rubber as far as Islamabad United are concerned. They are sitting pretty at the top of the table and are already through to the next stage but they must guard against any sort of complacency. Anyway, wait for the toss and teams which will be up in a while..

Hola! After 29 matches, it's all boiled down to this. We are into the final league game of PSL 2018 and still the 4th play-off berth is yet to be sealed. Just shows how competitive the tournament has been. Right then, two teams in the fray. Karachi Kings and Multan Sultans. The Kings take on Islamabad United in the second game of the day. The equation is straightforward for Karachi - win and progress. If they lose, they need to make sure that it doesn't affect their net run-rate badly because Multan are tied with 9 points too but their NRR is inferior compared to Karachi.
Teams:

Islamabad United (From): Luke Ronchi(w), Jean-Paul Duminy, Alex Hales, Hussain Talat, Asif Ali, Misbah-ul-Haq(c), Faheem Ashraf, Samit Patel, Shadab Khan, Amad Butt, Mohammad Sami, Zafar Gohar, Chadwick Walton, Sahibzada Farhan, Mohammad Hasan, Samuel Badree, Sam Billings, Steven Finn, Rohail Nazir, Iftikhar Ahmed

Karachi Kings (From): Babar Azam, Joe Denly, Colin Ingram, Eoin Morgan(c), Ravi Bopara, Shahid Afridi, Mohammad Rizwan(w), Usama Mir, Mohammad Irfan Jnr, Mohammad Amir, Usman Khan, Imad Wasim, Lendl Simmons, Tabish Khan, Saifullah Bangash, Tymal Mills, Hasan Mohsin, Mohammad Taha, David Wiese, Khurram Manzoor

latest_video.comm: Gohar to Denly, FOUR, flush on the adverts. Some flight dished up for a change, and Denly takes full toll. Makes room for himself, for his arms and goes inside-out over extra cover. Duminy does his part of giving it a six, but the umpires still want to go upstairs. And they've figured out it is on the half volley
